verses.verse: So I returned<WH7725>, and considered<WH7200> all the oppressions<WH6217> that are done<WH6213> under the sun<WH8121>: and behold the tears<WH1832> of such as were oppressed<WH6231>, and they had no comforter<WH5162>; and on the side<WH3027> of their oppressors<WH6231> there was power<WH3581>; but they had no comforter<WH5162>.
Therefore I praised<WH7623> the dead<WH4191> which are already<WH3528> dead<WH4191> more than the living<WH2416> which are yet<WH5728> alive<WH2416>.
Yes<WH2896>, better is he than both<WH8147> they<WH5728>, which has not yet been<WH7200>, who has not seen the evil<WH7451> work<WH4639> that is done<WH6213> under the sun<WH8121>.

Again<WH7200>, I considered all hardship<WH5999>, and every right<WH3788> work<WH4639>, that for this a man<WH376> is envied<WH7068> of his neighbor<WH7453>. This is also vanity<WH1892> and vexation<WH7469> of spirit<WH7307>.
The fool<WH3684> folds<WH2263> his hands<WH3027> together<WH2263>, and eat<WH398> his own flesh<WH1320>.
Better<WH2896> is a handful<WH3709> with quietness<WH5183>, than both the hands<WH2651> full<WH4393> with hardship<WH5999> and vexation<WH7469> of spirit<WH7307>.
Then I returned<WH7725>, and I saw<WH7200> vanity<WH1892> under the sun<WH8121>.

There is<WH3426> one<WH259> alone<WH8145>, and there is not a second; Yes<WH1121>, he has neither child nor brother<WH251>: yet is there no end<WH7093> of all his labor<WH5999>; neither is his eye<WH5869> satisfied<WH7646> with riches<WH6239>; neither says he<WH6001>, For whom do I labor, and bereave<WH2637> my soul<WH5315> of good<WH2896>? This is also vanity<WH1892>, Yes<WH7451>, it is a severe hardship<WH6045>.
Two<WH8147> are better<WH2896> than one<WH259>; because they have<WH3426> a good<WH2896> reward<WH7939> for their labor<WH5999>.

For if they fall<WH5307>, the one<WH259> will lift up<WH6965> his fellow<WH2270>: but woe<WH337> to him that is alone<WH259> when he falls<WH5307>; for he has not another<WH8145> to help him up<WH6965>.
Again<WH1571>, if two<WH8147> lie together<WH7901>, then they have heat<WH2552>: but how can one<WH259> be warm alone<WH3179>?
And if one<WH259> prevail<WH8630> against him<WH8147>, two shall withstand<WH5975> him<WH8027>; and a threefold cord<WH2339> is not quickly<WH4120> broken<WH5423>.
Better<WH2896> is a poor<WH4542> and a wise<WH2450> child<WH3206> than a old<WH2205> and foolish<WH3684> king<WH4428>, who will<WH3045> no more be admonished<WH2094>.
For out of prison<WH631> he comes<WH3318> to reign<WH4427>; whereas also he that is born<WH3205> in his kingdom<WH4438> becomes poor<WH7326>.
I considered<WH7200> all the living<WH2416> which walk<WH1980> under the sun<WH8121>, with the second<WH8145> child<WH3206> that shall stand up in his place<WH5975>.

There is no end<WH7093> of all the people<WH5971>, even of all that have been before<WH6440> them<WH314>: they also that come after shall not rejoice<WH8055> in him<WH1892>. Surely this also is vanity and vexation<WH7475> of spirit<WH7307>.
